column1: #Text=Listen , I need to go to a conference right now , can I call you back ?
#Text=[ Break for Congressman Hunter to attend a conference ]
#Text=That was with Senator Kennedy and Senator Levin , and they agreed to take the hate crimes bill off the defense bill , so we are going to move it forward and pass it , so it was good news .
#Text=That happens a lot where they put disparate bills together in the hopes of moving them together .
#Text=What are some of the positives and what are some of the negatives of doing that ?
#Text=We do pass out-of-scope legislation in the defense bill sometimes ; but the problem is putting in legislation that would n’t pass independently .
#Text=The downside is passing legislation that probably would n't pass or would n't be signed by the President otherwise .
#Text=Yeah , I support folks having a place where young people can go to have a quiet time after their substantive activities and have a prayer .
#Text=Not a moment of silence , but having a place where young people can go and prayer and still having that availability to do that .
#Text=I was the original author of it .
#Text=That Act would allow parents or guardians to sue in federal court anyone that disseminates material harmful to minors .
#Text=Yeah , pornographic material that hurts young people .
#Text=That 's one way to get to people that put out dirty images .
#Text=The key is that if they disseminate it in a way they can expect minors to see it , then they should be held liable for the damages of that material .
#Text=I came to that conclusion after watching the FCC operate in a very very haphazard and sluggish manner , very rarely responding to complaints .
#Text=And very under-manned even if they did respond energetically to complaints .
#Text=It gives parents the ability to hold pornographers liable for the damage to their children .
#Text=That 's the only way you are going to stop them , to hit them in their pocketbook because they obviously do n't care about the children .
#Text=Can you explain how that does not limit free speech , especially on the Internet ?
#Text=Free speech , for example -- nobody disagrees that somebody has a right to yell " Fire !
